page.title: 19 LOCAL PEOPLE 2.
page.content: MR. JOHN SMITH of Manor House Farm told us about his work. Wheat, barley and oats are grown and sold for animal feed and pet foods. Some rape is sold directly from the combine and two or three cuttings of cultivated grass are taken each year to be made into silage for winter feed. About thirty cows are kept for fattening to be sold as store cattle. A flock of eighty ewes provides lambs for sale as they are weaned. Chickens are intensively farmed with one unit being used to bring on 17,000 day old chickens. MR.McCABE is a veterinary surgeon. His most useful instrument is a syringe and the medicines most often used are antibiotics. Eczema is the most common illness affecting cats and dogs with polio and distemper the worst he has treated. He advises dogs and cats as lovely house pets.
